name: Amira (@amira.moves)
bio: Exceptional engagement for her tier. Deep authenticity in eco/wellness space (walks the talk). Connects strongly with women and BIPOC runners

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: “Run With Me” (morning runs in London parks)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: YouTube: 1 video/week (usually “day in the life” or workout vlog)
Activity: Consistent, with occasional week-long breaks for “digital detox” or travel

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: London, Manchester, Birmingham, Toronto

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: Audience is highly interested in sustainability, eco-brands, running, and wellness
Above-average engagement from university students and young professionals

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: GreenStride, Nike Move, Sable Water, ChillAloe, Adidas Run Club, ReGreener
Product reviews, unboxings, IG takeovers, sponsored runs, eco-brand roundups, paid story Q&As

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: Upbeat, approachable, ethical, motivating, spiritual (astrology, crystals)
Voice/Style: Warm, chatty, positive; on camera, mixes encouragement with dry humor.

sections.title: Potential Audience Overlaps
content: Maya (wellness, mindfulness), Cassie (body positivity, running), Layla (London- based wellness)

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Known for “life update” stories that sometimes spiral into astrology or pop culture tangents; some brand partners see this as off-message
Addresses feedback openly, known for apologizing or clarifying if a post gets misunderstood

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 20% off for 2+ platforms; 15% off/month for campaigns >3 months
Negotiation: Open, but prefers eco-conscious brands and campaigns with charity tie-ins

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: Deep authenticity in eco/wellness space (walks the talk)
Connects strongly with women and BIPOC runners

name: Luca (@lucab_run)
bio: Exceptionally engaging running vlogs and humor. Highly trusted on gear reviews and training advice. Community challenges and races create loyal, repeat viewers

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: Primary Content: Running, lifestyle, vlogs, fitness tips
“Run & Rant” (comedic running commentaries, often filmed during actual runs)
“Race Day Vlogs” (in-depth, start-to-finish coverage of major and minor UK races)
“Challenge Accepted” (monthly endurance or pace challenges, often with audience dares)
“Gear Check” (running tech, sneakers, and performance wear reviews)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: Activity: Generally consistent but takes spontaneous multi-day “offline” breaks for mental health; fans are used to it

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: London, Edinburgh, Liverpool, Bristol, Dublin

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: Large proportion are aspiring runners and student-athletes
Fans engage heavily with challenge and race content, plus gear recommendations

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: PaceLab, GatorLite UK, Adidas Run Club, JogLog, FlexiFuel, SunStreak Sunglasses
Challenge integrations, gear reviews, sponsored race entries, IG stories with product shoutouts, branded giveaway runs

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: Dry humor, practical, relatable, slightly chaotic, ultra-competitive, a little irreverent
Voice/Style: Witty and self-deprecating; mixes pep talks with running memes and pop culture riffs; delivers honest, sometimes blunt, reviews

sections.title: Potential Audience Overlaps
content: Dev (tech/gear reviews), Miles (sneaker and race day hype), Cassie (relatable running/lifestyle)

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Mild: Known for “disappearing” periodically to recharge, which can throw off strict campaign timelines
Reputation: Addresses absences honestly, fans appreciate transparency; some brands

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 20% off for multi-platform, 10% off per additional month
Negotiation: Generally open, especially for running and tech brands; prefers fewer, longer-term partnerships

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: Exceptionally engaging running vlogs and humor
Highly trusted on gear reviews and training advice
Community challenges and races create loyal, repeat viewers
Encourages positive running culture, not just competition

name: Maya (@mayathesun)
bio: Bilingual, multicultural, and internationally appealing. High authenticity and gentle authority in the wellness space. Excellent at brand storytelling without feeling forced

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: Primary Content: Mindful fitness, yoga, running, sustainable living
“Mindful Movement” (blend of yoga and functional workouts)
“Mental Health Reset” (guided meditations, journaling tips, self-care vlogs)
“Run with Maya” (gentle running sessions and group runs)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: Activity: Highly consistent, with a scheduled “mental health break” every other month (explained to audience)

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: London, Lisbon, Mumbai, Manchester, Toronto, Birmingham

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: Follows her for gentle motivation, sustainability, yoga, and “soothing” video style
Bilingual audience (English and Portuguese), small but vocal Indian following
Attracts students, young professionals, and expats

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: Lush Organics, BBC Earth, FlowMat, CalmSpace, GreenStride, Sable Water, Kora Activewear
Mindfulness challenges, eco-product roundups, IGTV yoga classes, “day in my life” sponsored vlogs, branded meditation guides

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: Soothing, authentic, wellness-focused, gentle authority, inclusive
Voice/Style: Calm, empathetic, softly spoken; her videos feature soft music, voiceovers, and serene editing

sections.title: Potential Audience Overlaps
content: Amira (eco-living & running), Priya (mindfulness and vegan content), Layla (wellness in London)

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Mild: High portion of audience is non-UK (about 35%), so reach for UK-centric brands can be diluted
Reputation: Transparent about audience split; sometimes creates “local only” or “UK- only” campaigns to boost relevance

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 15% for 2+ platforms, 10% off/month for multi-month deals
Negotiation: Very open to “value-driven” brands and long-term partnerships, especially in eco-wellness or wellness tech

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: High authenticity and gentle authority in the wellness space
Excellent at brand storytelling without feeling forced
Videos have “calming” effect; audience trusts her for self-care guidance

name: Dev
bio: Deepest technical authority in running/fitness tech space. Audience trusts his objectivity—rarely does “hype”. High-quality production, excellent at making data accessible

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: Primary Content: Fitness technology, gear reviews, myth-busting, athletic apparel
“Deep Dive Reviews” (in-depth breakdowns of running shoes, smartwatches, wearables)
“Mythbusting Mondays” (debunking health/fitness trends with research and demos)
“Unbox + Field Test” (real-world product demos, not just specs)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: YouTube: 1–2 long-form videos/week (15–25 mins, highly produced)
Instagram: 2–3 posts/week (mostly gear closeups and short reels), stories nearly daily
Twitter/X: 4–5 tweets per week, mainly hot takes, Q&As, and gear news
Activity: Highly reliable; posts on a schedule and rarely misses uploads
X/Twitter: Daily threads & hot takes on tech releases

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: London, Birmingham, Manchester, Delhi, Toronto

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: Large segment are techie runners, gear nerds, and performance hobbyists
Strong following among international students and UK urbanites

sections.title: Engagement Metrics
content: X/Twitter: High retweet rate on controversial tech opinions; viral threads common

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: RunTech, Adidas UK, VoltWear, Garmin, Sable Water, ReGreener, MindSprint
Sponsored gear reviews (always disclosed), campaign integrations, giveaway collaborations, “test-to-win” challenges

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: Analytical, transparent, highly knowledgeable, direct, pragmatic
Voice/Style: Calm, slightly dry humor, focused on objectivity; video style is clean, minimal, data-heavy with infographics and field shots

sections.title: Potential Audience Overlaps
content: Luca (gear, running tech), Priya (science-driven wellness), Zhang (sustainable gear, data-forward content)

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Mild: Some reviews are so technical that casual or new runners may feel excluded
Reputation: Always discloses sponsorships, never overpromises; respected as a “straight shooter” even by competitors

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 20% for multi-platform bundles, 10%/month off for >2 months
Negotiation: Open, but only takes brands whose claims he can vet and stand behind

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: Deepest technical authority in running/fitness tech space
High-quality production, excellent at making data accessible

name: Sierra (@sierra.leung)
bio: High-energy, visually striking content with viral appeal. Unique blend of athleticism and style—“urban fitness meets streetwear”. Excellent at executing bold branded stunts and pop-up city events

sections.title: Overview
content: Often cited by other influencers and even running blogs

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: Primary Content: Urban fitness, parkour, running, street style
“No Excuses Challenge” (urban obstacle courses, viewer dares)
“Run the City” (cinematic parkour/running montages in different UK locations)
“Epic Fails & Wins” (funny behind-the-scenes and stunts gone wrong)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: Activity: Extremely active and consistent; rarely misses a week

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: London, Birmingham, Glasgow, Hong Kong, Liverpool

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: Urban and suburban youth, sneakerheads, streetwear fans, and amateur athletes
Attracts both UK and Asian diaspora viewers, high engagement in city lifestyle subcultures

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: PWR Moves, SupremeFit, Boost+ Bars, Adidas UK, GlowStep Sneakers, Gearup Streetwear
Streetwear haul videos, “challenge” integrations, branded city run series, product placements in viral TikToks, and pop-up events

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: Energetic, daring, creative, “urban cool,” unapologetic
Voice/Style: Fast-paced, high-impact visuals, direct address, bold editing; known for stunts and confident on-camera presence

sections.title: Potential Audience Overlaps
content: Miles (street style and sneakers), Luca (urban running), Eliot Suárez (music and city culture)

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Significant: Faced controversy after third-party audit exposed a large portion of Instagram followers as bots; acknowledged issue and addressed with transparency posts and periodic follower cleanups
Reputation: Some brands remain cautious, but fans and many partners credit her for openly addressing the controversy and improving her account’s integrity

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 25% off for multi-platform, 15%/month for long-term partnerships
Negotiation: Open, especially to edgy and urban/activewear brands

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: High-energy, visually striking content with viral appeal
Unique blend of athleticism and style—“urban fitness meets streetwear”
Excellent at executing bold branded stunts and pop-up city events
Diverse, urban audience with international reach

name: Layla Freeman
bio: Exceptionally relatable and trusted for wellness and lifestyle. “Sunday Reset” series creates habitual viewers. Strong role model for young Black British women

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: Primary Content: Lifestyle, wellness, running, skincare, meal prep
“Sunday Reset” (weekly vlogs featuring cleaning, cooking, and prep routines)
“Running for Wellness” (gentle running routines, beginner tips)
“Day in the Life” (student/young professional routines, life updates)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: YouTube: 1 vlog/week (Sunday Reset or life update)
Activity: Consistent, only occasional pauses for travel or personal time

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: London, Birmingham, Bristol, Manchester, Kingston (Jamaica)

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: Follows her for relatable routines, gentle fitness, affordable wellness, and self- care tips
Strong appeal to students, young professionals, and Black British women
High engagement on posts about mental health and skincare

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: Simple Skincare, Tesco Wellness, ChillAloe, ReGreener, Sable Water, Urban Athletics, VIREO (fictional pilot campaign)
Skincare and wellness product reviews, “Reset with Me” vlogs featuring sponsored gear, morning routine integrations, sustainable haul stories

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: Warm, relatable, gentle, honest, “big sister” energy
Voice/Style: Friendly, soft-spoken, supportive; videos feature natural lighting, relaxed edits, and candid storytelling

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Mild: Audience sometimes glosses over technical product reviews, preferring daily routines and relatable struggles
Reputation: Always transparent about sponsorships and mental health; highly trusted for authenticity

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 15% for 2+ platforms, 12%/month for 3+ month campaigns
Negotiation: Flexible, prioritizes wellness and sustainable brands

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: Exceptionally relatable and trusted for wellness and lifestyle
Strong role model for young Black British women
Gentle, supportive approach stands out in a crowded space

name: Kian Murphy
bio: Great crossover audience—strong in both Ireland and UK. Exceptional at making “city running” accessible and fun. Real-world meetups foster highly loyal, active local community

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: Primary Content: Outdoor adventure, urban running, travel vlogs, eco gear reviews
“Day in My Life: City Runner” (cinematic running vlogs across different UK cities)
“Gear on the Go” (testing niche and sustainable running accessories)
“Urban Adventure Challenges” (exploring hidden city trails, race day narratives)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: Instagram: 2–3 posts/week + regular stories (live updates from runs and meetups)
TikTok: 2–4 short-form videos/week (trail highlights, quick gear shoutouts)
Activity: Steady, with occasional travel breaks; always notifies followers when going off- grid

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: Dublin, London, Manchester, Belfast, Glasgow

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: Strong engagement from Irish runners, urban explorers, and student athletes
Audience loves “hidden gems” content—urban trails, niche gear, city culture

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: FlexiFuel, TrailBound, GreenStride, Boost+ Bars, Lumo Shoes, ReGreener
Gear review integrations, “city run” event sponsorships, sustainable brand shoutouts, and Instagram Live Q&As with product demos

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Voice/Style: Cinematic but down-to-earth; narrates runs with practical advice, banter, and scenic shots; easygoing with an Irish lilt

sections.title: Potential Audience Overlaps
content: Luca (urban running), Miles (gear reviews, street culture), Sierra (city fitness challenges)

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Notable: 40% of audience is Irish rather than UK-based—potential misfit for UK-only campaigns
Reputation: Transparent about audience split and happy to target Irish and cross-border UK campaigns

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 20% for cross-platform bundles, 10%/month for long-term contracts
Negotiation: Flexible and open to collabs with niche or student-friendly brands

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: Great crossover audience—strong in both Ireland and UK
Exceptional at making “city running” accessible and fun
Real-world meetups foster highly loyal, active local community

name: Hiba (@hibatriesagain)
bio: Humor and “challenge” angle drives engagement and virality. Excellent at building community around peer-to-peer challenges. Relatable, supportive, and especially trusted by South Asian and Muslim women

sections.title: Overview
content: Adventure/hidden gems content gives brands an “explorer” edge

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: Primary Content: Fitness, running, wellness, humor
“Try With Hiba” (funny fitness challenges, first-time reviews of brands and gear)
“Charity Run Diaries” (vlogs from fundraising and wellness events)
“Swap Spotlight” (sustainable product swaps, often with giveaways)
“Fitness for Fun” (skits, lighthearted training videos, and group runs)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: Activity: Very active, with occasional short breaks for event travel or Ramadan

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: Manchester, Birmingham, London, Bradford, Lahore

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: Audience loves humor, peer challenges, and approachable fitness
Highly engaged South Asian and Muslim women audience
Strong interest in eco swaps, peer-to-peer recommendations, and community events

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: MoveMore UK, VIREO, ChillAloe, Sable Water, StepUp Apparel, TidyGreen
Challenge integrations, event appearances, eco swap reviews, charity run sponsorships, TikTok challenge series

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: Energetic, humorous, inclusive, playful, “your workout BFF”
Voice/Style: Goofy, enthusiastic, never takes herself too seriously; relatable, high-energy edits with candid voiceovers

sections.title: Potential Audience Overlaps
content: Layla (wellness for women), Cassie (fitness for beginners), Priya (eco swaps and vegan lifestyle)

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Mild: Posts sometimes get muted or taken down due to use of copyrighted/trending sounds in challenge videos
Reputation: Addresses copyright flags openly, asks audience for royalty-free music suggestions; fans appreciate her transparency

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 20% for misc. bundles, 12%/month for multi-month partnerships
Negotiation: Flexible, loves collab-based and charity-integrated projects

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: Humor and “challenge” angle drives engagement and virality
Excellent at building community around peer-to-peer challenges
Relatable, supportive, and especially trusted by South Asian and Muslim women
Quick to adapt to new trends and audience suggestions

name: Miles
bio: Expert in both “hype” and actual performance gear. High trust among sneaker and urban fitness fans. Drives energetic conversations and product virality

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: Primary Content: Urban running, sneaker reviews, street style, gear drops
“Sneaker Spotlight” (unboxing and reviewing new running shoes)
“Urban Run Tour” (exploring city neighborhoods and urban trails)
“Hype vs. Performance” (rating trendy gear for actual use)
“Debate Night” (Twitter threads debating running tech and sneaker releases)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: Instagram: 3 posts/week + stories several times/week (unboxings, Q&As, style picks)
TikTok: 2 videos/week (sneaker closeups, quick gear reviews)
Twitter/X: 4–7 tweets/week (debates, live race commentary, meme threads)
Activity: Very consistent, highly responsive to sneaker drops and trending news
X/Twitter: Live-tweeting races and viral running memes (3-5x/day)

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: London, Birmingham, Manchester, New York City

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: Fans are sneakerheads, urban runners, street style followers, and gear enthusiasts
Engaged, high-energy community—loves polls and debates about gear

sections.title: Engagement Metrics
content: X/Twitter: High engagement during major marathon weekends

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: EcoRun (VIREO), Nike, Boost+ Bars, JogLog, Foot Locker UK, Lumo Shoes
Sneaker unboxings and reviews, “hype drops” campaigns, Instagram Live Q&As, Twitter poll integrations, branded urban runs

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: Witty, trend-savvy, urban, energetic, unapologetic
Voice/Style: Fast-talking, meme-driven, direct; mixes genuine enthusiasm with tongue- in-cheek critiques

sections.title: Potential Audience Overlaps
content: Sierra (streetwear, urban fitness), Luca (running tech), Kian Murphy (city running, gear)

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Mild: Gets drawn into heated sneaker and gear debates on Twitter, sometimes sparking strong opinions and brand “wars”
Reputation: Known for owning his takes, sometimes posts clarifications if debates get out of hand; fans appreciate his honesty

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Negotiation: Prefers brands with “real street cred,” flexible on bundle deals

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: Expert in both “hype” and actual performance gear
High trust among sneaker and urban fitness fans
Drives energetic conversations and product virality

name: Cassie (@cassmakesachange)
bio: One of the few plus-size and non-binary focused running creators. High trust among marginalized runners and new fitness joiners. Uplifting, educational content that builds genuine community

sections.title: Overview
content: Strong reach among Black British and Ghanaian urban youth

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: Primary Content: Body positivity, plus-size fitness, running for all, community self-care
“Move for Joy” (celebrating non-competitive movement, fun runs)
“Gear for Every Body” (honest reviews of running/lifestyle products for plus-size and non-binary runners)
“Q&A Sundays” (answering community questions about fitness, motivation, and mental health)
“Workout Real Talk” (debunking fitness myths and addressing toxic fitness culture)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: TikTok: 3 videos/week (skits, gear reviews, pep talks)
Instagram: 2 posts/week + stories (outfit shares, fitness memes, Q&As)
Activity: Very consistent, rarely takes breaks longer than a few days

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: London, Leeds, Sheffield, Manchester, Cardiff

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: Community of plus-size runners, LGBTQ+ athletes, and body-positive advocates
Audience loves interactive challenges and authentic gear reviews
Regular engagement from non-binary and queer followers

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: Boldly Body, VIREO, RunHappy, GreenStride, ChillAloe
Gear reviews and hauls, body positivity Q&As, branded “move for joy” challenge videos, panel appearances for fitness diversity

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: No-nonsense, uplifting, inclusive, witty, community-driven
Voice/Style: Honest, slightly irreverent, uses UK pop culture references; known for deadpan delivery and dry humor

sections.title: Potential Audience Overlaps
content: Layla (wellness for women), Hiba (fitness for all), Amira (inclusive running), Anika Sethi (non-binary/LGBTQ+ advocacy)

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Mild: Niche humor and references may confuse new or older followers; some content is very UK-specific
Reputation: Proactively explains jokes and engages in positive education, keeps a welcoming tone for all followers

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 18% for misc. bundles, 10%/month for multi-month deals
Negotiation: Open, especially for brands focusing on inclusivity and accessibility

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: One of the few plus-size and non-binary focused running creators
High trust among marginalized runners and new fitness joiners
Uplifting, educational content that builds genuine community

name: Eliot (@tagitbagitrunit)
bio: Unique fusion of music, art, and running content. Highly engaged bilingual, multicultural urban audience. Creative visuals, playlist curation, and in-person event hosting

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: Primary Content: Running, street art, urban lifestyle, music
“Graffiti Run” (urban runs with stops at famous murals and street art)
“Run to the Beat” (curated playlists for different running moods)
“Meet the Artist” (collabs/interviews with local musicians and muralists)
“Tips in the City” (quick advice for running safely in urban spaces)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: Instagram: 3 posts/week + daily stories (often music and art related)
YouTube: 2–3 videos/month (urban vlogs, playlist collabs, art/running culture)
TikTok: 1–2 videos/week (urban running tips, street art moments)
Activity: Active, but sometimes skips weeks when working on longer creative collabs

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: London, Manchester, Liverpool, Bogotá, Bristol

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: High concentration of urban runners, music lovers, and art students
Strong engagement from Latin & Hispanic diaspora, and bilingual (Spanish/English) audience
Audience appreciates “cultural” angles as much as fitness tips

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: MusicBuds, GreenStride, VIREO, RunStreak, WallBeat Headphones, Spray UK
Branded playlist launches, running gear reviews, “run & art” event vlogs, music collabs, mural unveilings with fitness sponsors

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: Creative, expressive, urban, eclectic, collaborative
Voice/Style: Artistic, energetic, blends street culture with runner’s discipline; uses bilingual captions and upbeat soundtracks

sections.title: Potential Audience Overlaps
content: Miles (urban running, street style), Sierra (city/parkour), Kian Murphy (city culture), Amira (music/art crossovers)

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Mild: Sometimes prioritizes unpaid creative collabs and art projects over sponsored posts, leading to irregular schedules and unpredictable deliverables
Reputation: Known for being upfront with partners, but some brands find him hard to schedule

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Negotiation: Prefers creative, music/art-driven partnerships; flexible for long-term collabs

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: Unique fusion of music, art, and running content
Highly engaged bilingual, multicultural urban audience
Creative visuals, playlist curation, and in-person event hosting

name: Priya  (@priyaplacesfirst)
bio: Makes sustainability and nutrition science accessible and fun. Beloved by vegan and eco-conscious runners. High credibility—audience trusts her research and advice

sections.title: Overview
content: Trusted for authenticity and cultural relevance

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: Primary Content: Vegan marathon training, endurance running, food/recipes, minimalist living
“Run, Eat, Repeat” (endurance training routines paired with vegan meals)
“Plant Power Prep” (easy vegan meal preps for runners)
“Marathon Minimalist” (training and lifestyle for those who want less clutter and more efficiency)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: Instagram: 4 posts/week + frequent stories (meals, runs, Q&A)
TikTok: 3 videos/week (recipe demos, “run & review,” science snippets)
YouTube: 2 videos/month (deep-dive training or food vlogs)
Activity: Very consistent, with brief breaks during race travel or training peaks

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: London, Leicester, Birmingham, Kochi, Bristol

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: High engagement from vegan, vegetarian, and eco-conscious runners
Audience loves “snackable” science and practical nutrition tips
Student-heavy, many early-career professionals and international viewers

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: GreenStride, EcoEats, Sable Water, VIREO, VeganFuel UK, Runner’s Reset
Vegan recipe integrations, sustainable gear reviews, sponsored marathon diaries, branded science explainer posts

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: Knowledgeable, approachable, eco-driven, motivating, science-focused
Voice/Style: Friendly, down-to-earth, uses analogies and infographics; voiceovers are warm and occasionally cheeky

sections.title: Potential Audience Overlaps
content: Maya (wellness, science), Layla (practical wellness), Dev (science/data), Hiba (eco swaps)

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Notable: Heavy focus on veganism sometimes alienates mainstream or flexitarian runners
Reputation: Handles disagreements openly, moderates debate but stands by her ethics

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 20% for misc. bundles, 10%/month for multi-month deals
Negotiation: Open, but prioritizes brands that are vegan, cruelty-free, and sustainability- certified

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: Makes sustainability and nutrition science accessible and fun
Beloved by vegan and eco-conscious runners
High credibility—audience trusts her research and advice
Combines athleticism with minimalist, relatable living

name: Joel McLeod
bio: Expert mythbuster; great for evidence-first campaigns. Trusted coach persona—direct, honest, and often motivational. Excellent engagement with male and older fitness audiences

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: Primary Content: Fitness coaching, mythbusting, explosive workouts, recovery
“Mythbusting Mondays” (debunking fitness fads, trends, and “bro science”)
“Explosive Workouts” (HIIT routines, circuit training, power challenges)
“Coach Reacts” (reviewing viral fitness clips and trends)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: TikTok: 3–4 videos/week (quick routines, debunks, trending audio challenges)
Instagram: 1–2 posts/week + regular stories (training updates, Q&A)
Activity: Consistent, known for timely responses to trends and controversies
LinkedIn: Daily leadership tips and executive coaching insights

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: London, Glasgow, Manchester, Birmingham, Dublin

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: Strong following among beginner-to-intermediate gym goers, new runners, and fitness mythbusters
Audience likes “evidence-first” approach and direct, coach-like feedback
Higher engagement from 25–40 age group than most VIREO influencers

sections.title: Engagement Metrics
content: LinkedIn: High engagement from C-suite executives and founders

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: FlexiFuel, JogLog, PaceLab, VIREO, ChillAloe, Adidas Run Club
Product integrations in debunking videos, “coach tries” gear reviews, challenge campaigns, Instagram Live Q&A for partner brands

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: Confident, direct, high-energy, fact-focused, “no BS” coach
Voice/Style: Motivational, slightly sarcastic, educational; uses evidence-based graphics, and isn’t afraid to call out misinformation

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Significant: Spread viral misinformation about “natural” injury recovery supplements, then quietly deleted videos/posts without formal apology or correction
Reputation: Lost some brand trust; now more explicit about source-checking and

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 15% for misc. bundles, 10%/month for ongoing campaigns
Negotiation: Open, prefers brands willing to collaborate on transparent, factual campaigns

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: Expert mythbuster; great for evidence-first campaigns
Trusted coach persona—direct, honest, and often motivational
Excellent engagement with male and older fitness audiences

name: Sonia Chukwuma (@sonia.frfr)

name: Leah (@leahrunswild)

name: Yusuf (@yusuf_vs_theworld)

sections.title: Content Type & Niche

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: Instagram: 2 posts/week (holistic running tips, recovery routines, wellness stories)
TikTok: 2–3 videos/week (guided breathing, “healing hacks,” yoga demos)

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: London, Birmingham, Cairo, Manchester, Dubai

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Significant: Promotes crystal healing for sports injury recovery, sometimes making claims about “accelerated healing”; this has attracted skeptical comments and pushback from healthcare professionals

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 15% for misc. bundles, 10%/month for ongoing
Negotiation: Very open, particularly for wellness and spiritual brands

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points

Strong engagement on mindfulness and yoga content

name: Tina (@tinawellcity)
bio: Exceptionally accessible, practical fitness and wellness for city students. Known for honest, supportive, non-intimidating approach. Good at bite-sized, budget-friendly content

sections.title: Overview
content: Regularly covers affordable and accessible gear

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: Primary Content: Everyday fitness, quick city jogs, low-impact routines, practical meal- prep, student wellness
“City Jog Logs” (short city runs with motivational tips and route highlights)
“Easy Wellness Hacks” (practical tips for staying healthy with limited time/space)
“Meal-Prep for Movers” (easy, budget-friendly meal ideas for active students)
“Wellness on the Go” (gentle routines for busy schedules, self-care Q&As)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: Instagram: 1–2 posts/week (jog selfies, wellness tips, quick recipes)
TikTok: 2 videos/week (routine demos, mini meal-preps, pep talks)
YouTube: 1–2 videos/month (routine walkthroughs, city living advice)
Activity: Steady, with rare short breaks around exam seasons or personal events

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: London, Manchester, Birmingham, Glasgow, Hong Kong

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: Large student and young professional audience
Attracts viewers interested in practical wellness and fitness for beginners

sections.title: Engagement Metrics
content: LinkedIn: Strong engagement from university wellbeing officers

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: ChillAloe, VIREO, Sable Water, CityFit UK, BudgetFit
“Wellness hack” integrations, student meal-prep features, city run gear reviews, gentle routine demos

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: Supportive, practical, calm (with flashes of wit), “realistic” wellness advocate
Voice/Style: Gentle, upbeat, speaks from personal experience; approachable, with a focus on sustainability and easy wins

sections.title: Potential Audience Overlaps
content: Layla (student wellness), Zhang (practical eco fitness), Bethan Evans (budget/accessible wellness), Ari (gentle routines)

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Notable: Public argument with a doctor influencer over NHS wait times—her criticisms were factually justified but delivered in unexpectedly sharp, sarcastic language. This clash with her usual persona surprised followers, leading to some negative press and lingering doubts about her “genuineness.” She posted a public apology and returned to positive content, but trust has only partially recovered.
Reputation: Generally viewed as genuine, but now seen by some as “two-faced” or
inconsistent; careful about tone in current posts

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 12% for misc. bundles, 8%/month for long-term
Negotiation: Very open, especially for brands targeting students, women, and beginner-friendly wellness

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: Exceptionally accessible, practical fitness and wellness for city students
Known for honest, supportive, non-intimidating approach
Fills gap for “it’s okay to do less” wellness, especially during stressful seasons

Audience values approachable, non-intimidating advice and authentic content

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: Sponsored run recovery tutorials, gear swaps, “eco routine” integrations, meal- prep collabs

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: Warm, relatable, gentle, accessible, supportive
Voice/Style: Down-to-earth, practical, quietly motivating; makes running and recovery feel achievable for all

sections.title: Potential Audience Overlaps
content: Layla (wellness, relatable advice), Tina (practical student wellness), Yusuf El-Amin (mindful routines), Cassie (inclusive, first-timer fitness)

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Mild: Branded/sponsored posts often underperform compared to “day-in-the-life” or organic content. Sponsored collaborations may feel less authentic to her audience
Reputation: Maintains trust by being selective with sponsors and always sharing honest

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 12% for misc. bundles, 7%/month for long-term deals
Negotiation: Very open, especially for eco, wellness, and beginner-focused brands

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: Exceptionally relatable, approachable for first-time runners
Practical, non-intimidating advice on eco routines and recovery
High trust for honest reviews and gentle, real-life vlogs

name: Hannah (@hannahtherunner)
bio: Ultra-accessible, beginner-friendly advice; low intimidation factor. Focus on simple eco habits for city students. Cheerful, supportive voice that encourages fitness “from zero”

sections.title: Overview
content: Small but dedicated and diverse audience, with strong Southeast Asian reach

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: Primary Content: Bite-sized running tips, “easy swaps” for sustainability, beginner- friendly wellness
“Green Run Tips” (simple running advice, often with a sustainability angle)
“Eco-Easy Swaps” (quick reels about making sustainable choices in daily life)
“Starter Routines” (basic running and warm-up guides for first-timers)
“Motivation Minis” (pep talks and easy wins for new runners)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: TikTok: 2 videos/week (running tips, easy swaps, mini-challenges)
Instagram: 1–2 posts/week (quick tips, infographics, wellness check-ins)
Activity: Regular and reliable, especially during back-to-school and spring/summer seasons

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: London, Manchester, Liverpool, Bristol, Birmingham

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: Follower base is mostly students and young adults just starting fitness journeys
Viewers appreciate approachable, non-intimidating advice and “anyone can start” message
Limited engagement from advanced runners or seasoned fitness buffs

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: Product placements in “easy swap” tips, beginner-friendly challenge integrations, IG reels with green product demos

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: Friendly, encouraging, practical, relatable, beginner-focused
Voice/Style: Simple, upbeat, keeps advice direct and unintimidating; loves making fitness and eco-living feel accessible

sections.title: Potential Audience Overlaps
content: Tina (student-friendly wellness), Ari (gentle, practical advice), Layla (wellness on a budget), Bethan Evans (local/beginner running)

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Mild: Tips are sometimes so simplified that more advanced or ambitious followers disengage; rarely posts more challenging or technical advice
Reputation: Known for “keep it simple” mantra; some requests for more advanced or
varied content, but her brand is firmly “accessible first”

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 10% for misc. bundles, 5%/month for ongoing
Negotiation: Very open; values brands focused on accessibility, student deals, and green living

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: Ultra-accessible, beginner-friendly advice; low intimidation factor
Focus on simple eco habits for city students
Cheerful, supportive voice that encourages fitness “from zero”

name: Sam (@sammorisson)
bio: Exceptionally high trust—followers love the honesty and “real life” approach. Strong community interaction; followers feel seen and heard. Candid, self-deprecating humor makes sponsored content more relatable

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: Primary Content: “Run with me” vlogs, honest gear reviews, fitness community building
“Run With Sam” (POV vlogs and guided runs)
“Real Talk Reviews” (gear reviews—pros, cons, and candid impressions)
“Challenge Check-Ins” (monthly goals, setbacks, and updates on training progress)
“Community Shoutouts” (featuring followers, local runners, or gear tips from fans)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: Instagram: 2 posts/week (run recaps, shoutouts, gear picks)
TikTok: 2–3 videos/week (vlogs, quick reviews, motivational check-ins)
YouTube: 2 videos/month (longer “run with me” vlogs, gear roundups)
Activity: Very consistent; content sometimes spikes before/after race events

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: London, Liverpool, Sheffield, Manchester, Birmingham

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: Community vibe is central—followers interact regularly, tag each other, and share run stories
Sam’s “honest review” approach and self-deprecating humor boost trust
Strong engagement with regional UK runners and fitness newcomers

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: “Run with me” sponsored vlogs, honest gear review integrations, Instagram Q&A or “real talk” product posts

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: Honest, supportive, transparent, self-deprecating, community-oriented
Voice/Style: Candid, occasionally cheeky, sometimes uses regional slang; combines encouragement with humor and realism

sections.title: Potential Audience Overlaps
content: Cassie (community fitness), Layla (wellness), Luca (casual run vlogs), Tina (accessible student wellness)

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Mild: Frequent use of regional slang and UK in-jokes can limit accessibility and appeal outside his core audience
Reputation: Community loves the authentic touch, but brands seeking
national/international reach should request more “universal” content when needed

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 10% for misc. bundles, 8%/month for ongoing
Negotiation: Very open, especially for brands focused on authenticity, beginner-friendly fitness, and community campaigns

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: Exceptionally high trust—followers love the honesty and “real life” approach
Strong community interaction; followers feel seen and heard
Candid, self-deprecating humor makes sponsored content more relatable

name: Kenji (@kenjicityrun)
bio: Strong city/minimalist visual style, appealing to young urban runners. Relatable tech and gear advice for small apartment/urban living. Consistent focus on eco gear and smart solutions

sections.title: Overview
content: Fills the niche for regional, everyday running content

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: Primary Content: Minimalist city running, tech reviews for runners, eco gear for urban life
“City Run Aesthetics” (stylized city jogs, architecture shots, minimalist workout vlogs)
“Tech for Tiny Spaces” (best fitness gadgets for small apartments and urban living)
“Smart Run Gear” (in-depth reviews of watches, headphones, and smart accessories)
“Route of the Week” (highlighting London’s coolest and most underrated running routes)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: Instagram: 1–2 posts/week (aesthetic city shots, gear flatlays, quick tips)
TikTok: 2 videos/week (urban run vlogs, tech reviews, POV gear demos)
YouTube: 1 video/month (detailed gadget reviews, urban route guides)
Activity: Highly variable—peaks during tech launches, new gear drops, and spring/summer; quieter in winter or between campaigns

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: London, Tokyo, Manchester, Birmingham, Edinburgh

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: Audience skews young, urban, tech-savvy, and design-conscious
Strong appeal for students and new professionals in small city flats
High engagement from followers interested in minimalist aesthetics and eco gear

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: RunTech, VIREO, EcoFit, Minimal Gear, ChillAloe
Tech gear integrations, “best gadgets for city runners,” urban gear styling reels, route highlights with product placements

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: Minimalist, techy, calm, visual, detail-oriented
Voice/Style: Clean, concise, visually driven; prefers sleek visuals, pastel/monochrome palettes, and direct-to-camera gear demos

sections.title: Potential Audience Overlaps
content: Rajiv Sharma (tech reviews), Zhang (minimalist eco style), Luca (urban running), Tina (city wellness)

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Mild: Highly variable engagement—posts spike during major launches or tech drops, but dip in off-seasons or when posting less frequently
Reputation: No major controversies; transparent about posting schedule and takes

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 12% for misc. bundles, 7%/month for long-term
Negotiation: Very open, especially for brands with sleek, modern, or eco/tech angles

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: Strong city/minimalist visual style, appealing to young urban runners
Relatable tech and gear advice for small apartment/urban living
Consistent focus on eco gear and smart solutions

name: Charlotte (@runwithcharlotte)
bio: Powerful support for women restarting fitness after injury or burnout. Honest, no-nonsense voice with gentle encouragement. Fills a needed gap for “gentle” running and mental health-first content

sections.title: Overview
content: High spikes in engagement around launches and new releases

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: Primary Content: Gentle running, mental health, injury recovery, re-entering fitness
“Gentle Run Diaries” (slow run logs, mindfulness moments, gentle progress updates)
“Back to Fitness” (recovery journeys, injury support, motivation for starting over)
“Mental Health Mondays” (open chats, supportive vlogs, Q&A)
“Culture Conversations” (discusses running trends, opinions on training culture)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: Instagram: 2 posts/week (gentle run recaps, wellness check-ins, supportive messages)
TikTok: 1–2 videos/week (short vlogs, mental health tips, gentle workouts)
YouTube: 1 video/month (deep-dive discussions, Q&A, interview collabs)
Activity: Consistent, especially around “restart” and mental health awareness seasons

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: London, Bristol, Manchester, Edinburgh, Leeds

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: Follower base is primarily young women recovering from burnout/injury or restarting fitness
High engagement on supportive, open, and honest posts
Followers seek community, encouragement, and gentle advice—not “hardcore” motivation

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: Gentle run routines, “recovery journey” content, mental health campaign integrations, supportive challenge posts

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: Supportive, honest, thoughtful, sometimes opinionated, resilient
Voice/Style: Calm, open, gentle but direct; not afraid to share strong views on running culture and recovery

sections.title: Potential Audience Overlaps
content: Layla (wellness, candid advice), Hannah (gentle/beginner fitness), Ari (recovery- first content), Tina (mental health/wellness)

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Mild: Has strong, sometimes polarizing opinions on running culture—occasionally debates followers or pushes back in comment sections, which can make brands nervous about potential for online disputes
Reputation: Highly respected for honesty; followers appreciate debate, but brands
sometimes request content moderation for sensitive topics

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 12% for misc. bundles, 8%/month for long-term
Negotiation: Very open, especially for wellness, recovery, and mental health brands

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: Powerful support for women restarting fitness after injury or burnout
Honest, no-nonsense voice with gentle encouragement
Fills a needed gap for “gentle” running and mental health-first content

name: Anika Sethi (@anika4all)
bio: Uniquely inclusive, non-binary and LGBTQ+ perspective on running and wellness. Highly supportive, welcoming, and practical advice. Regular Q&A builds community trust and ongoing engagement

sections.title: Overview
content: Active, engaged community; frequent two-way conversation

sections.title: Content Type & Niche
content: Primary Content: Inclusive fitness, LGBTQ+ running, accessible training, sustainability
“Run with Pride” (spotlighting LGBTQ+ runners, inclusive gear, allyship tips)
“Ask Anika” (Q&A on training, accessibility, and non-binary experiences in sport)
“Day in the Life” (vlogs mixing running, activism, and everyday wellness)

sections.title: Posting Frequency & Activity
content: Instagram: 2 posts/week (inclusive training highlights, Q&A, gear picks)
TikTok: 2–3 videos/week (short vlogs, product demos, “run with me” stories)
YouTube: 2 videos/month (deeper dives, inclusive running advice, social commentary)
Activity: Consistent, with extra content during Pride, LGBTQ+ History Month, and major campaigns
LinkedIn: Bi-weekly thought leadership on DE&I in sports

sections.title: Audience Demographics
content: Top Locations: London, Manchester, Brighton, Birmingham, Glasgow

sections.title: Other Insights:
content: Highly engaged in discussions of accessibility, inclusivity, and sustainability
Audience values community, visibility, and practical advice for “everybody”

sections.title: Engagement Metrics
content: LinkedIn: High share rate by corporate diversity networks

sections.title: Brand Partnerships & Sponsored Content
content: VIREO, Sable Water, GreenStride, Mindful Path
Inclusive gear reviews, Pride campaign integrations, “accessible fitness” challenges, Q&A sponsorships

sections.title: Brand Persona & Image
content: Traits: Inclusive, activist, supportive, candid, community-focused
Voice/Style: Warm, thoughtful, openly discusses both running and broader social topics; mixes informative and personal content

sections.title: Potential Audience Overlaps
content: Cassie (inclusive fitness), Priya (accessible/eco content), Tina (wellness for all), Layla (student/wellness tips)

sections.title: Potential Controversies
content: Notable: Occasionally discusses social topics beyond running (e.g., trans rights, inclusive sports policies, activism) which can polarize or alienate more conservative audiences and some brands
Reputation: Audience is highly loyal, but some mainstream brands hesitate with

sections.title: Pricing & Collaboration Terms
content: Discounts: 12% for misc. bundles, 8%/month for ongoing
Negotiation: Very open, especially for inclusive, accessible, and sustainability-focused brands

sections.title: Strengths & Unique Selling Points
content: Uniquely inclusive, non-binary and LGBTQ+ perspective on running and wellness
Highly supportive, welcoming, and practical advice
Regular Q&A builds community trust and ongoing engagement
Advocates for accessible, sustainable fitness for all
